results.definition: a small amount of solid food; a mouthful
examples: all they had left was a bit of bread

results.definition: a small piece or quantity of something
examples: I gave him a bit of my mind

results.definition: a short performance that is part of a longer program
a small fragment of something broken off from the whole
examples: a bit of rock caught him in the eye
he had a bit of good luck

results.definition: a unit of measurement of information (from binary + digit); the amount of information in a system having two equiprobable states
examples: there are 8 bits in a byte

results.definition: piece of metal held in horse's mouth by reins and used to control the horse while riding
examples: the horse was not accustomed to a bit

results.definition: the cutting part of a drill; usually pointed and threaded and is replaceable in a brace or bitstock or drill press
examples: he looked around for the right size bit

results.definition: the part of a key that enters a lock and lifts the tumblers
